intro: Cordia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian cordia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture, while its bark is thick and fissured. Cordia boliviana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
